pullRequest.body:
Defines operads (`Operad`), symmetric operads (`SymmOperad`), and clones (`Clone`). There is a proof that all clones have a natural operad structure. And there is a file, `Instances.lean`, that gives several most important examples of Clones. In particular, it has all of the clones (in an appropriately general form) that occur in [Post's Lattice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post%27s_lattice), and later proving the completeness of Post's Lattice is why I'm making this PR.

Marking as draft at the moment while there are some sorries, but wanting this PR up hoping for some preliminary comments

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

<details><summary>

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Operad.Basic` (new file)|188|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Operad.Perm` (new file)|459|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Operad.Operad` (new file)|471|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Operad.Clone` (new file)|530|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Operad.Instances` (new file)|836|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ PermFinPadAt_gt_gt_position`
`+ PermFinPadAt_gt_lt_position`
`+ PermFinPadAt_lt_gt_position`
`+ PermFinPadAt_lt_lt_position`
`+ PermFinPadAt_symm`
`+ PermFinPadLeftRight`
`+ PermFinPadTo`
`+ PermFinPadTo_eq_PermFinPadLeftRight`
`+ PermFinPadTo_eq_position`
`+ PermFinPadTo_gt_position`
`+ PermFinPadTo_lt_position`
`+ ProjectableProperty`
`+ SigmaMulAction`
`+ Superposable`
`+ SuperposableProperty`
`+ SymmOperad`
`+ SymmOperad.compose_smul`
`+ SymmOperad.smul_compose`
`+ and_ClonalProperty`
`+ clonal_CommutesWithEndo`
`+ clonal_Conjunctive`
`+ clonal_Disjunctive`
`+ clonal_EssentiallyUnary`
`+ clonal_IsAffineMap`
`+ clonal_IsMultiargAffine`
`+ clonal_Monotone`
`+ clonal_kWisePropPreserving`
`+ cloneCompose`
`+ cloneCompose_assoc`
`+ cloneCompose_id`
`+ cloneCompse_comm`
`+ clonePadTo`
`+ clonePadTo_zero`
`+ clone_AffineMap`
`+ clone_ClonalProperty`
`+ clone_id_left`
`+ clone_proj_left`
`+ clone_proj_right`
`+ clone_toSymmOperad`
`+ composeAt`
`+ composeAt_assoc`
`+ composeAt_assoc_Fin`
`+ composeAt_comm`
`+ composeAt_comm_Fin`
`+ composeAt_comm_four`
`+ composeAt_comm_swap`
`+ composeAt_id`
`+ conjunctive_min`
`+ disjunctive_max`
`+ eq_id_sigma_id`
`+ eq_id_sigma_one`
`+ function_superpose`
`+ hAdd`
`+ id_composeAt`
`+ instance : ∀ (i : ℕ), MulAction (Perm (Fin i)) (A i)`
`+ kWisePropPreserving`
`+ kWisePropPreserving_Clone`
`+ sigmaMul_to_MulAction`
`+ superpose`
`+ val_hAdd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Operad is currently defined in terms of composing just two functions (and identities in all other slots). It would be good to add the "fill all slots" notion of composition instead, see e.g. the definition on Wikipedia: With an appropriate alternate constructor for `Operad` in terms of this other definition.

Could you please split this into 5 PRs? One for each new file?
And have all of them refer back to this one, so that the context is clear.

> Marking as draft at the moment while there are some sorries, but wanting this PR up hoping for some preliminary comments

Also, it seems that it is time to remove this disclaimer from the PR commit message. :grinning:
This is a very ugly long proof and I would very much like to see it cleaned up. I will try, later, I guess.

pullRequest.title: feat: operads and clones
